sentences.sContent: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.sCn: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.sContent: Firefighters managed to confine the fire to the living room.
sentences.sCn: 消防队员设法把火势控制在起居室内。

remMethod.val: con(表加强) ＋ fin(范围) ＋ e → 限制

words.tran: 狭窄的；幽禁的；有限制的；在分娩中的
受限的，限制的；狭窄的，偏狭的；拘束的
限制（confine的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
